title: Code of Conduct

embed.description: PLEASE READ THIS TERMS OF USE AGREEMENT (THIS "TERMS OF USE" OR " AGREEMENT") CAREFULLY. BY CLICKING THE "ACCEPT" BUTTON BELOW, OR BY PARTICIPATING IN THE GAME, OR BY USING THE HTTP://NA.LEAGUEOFLEGENDS.COM WEBSITE AND RELATED WEBPAGES (THE " SITE "), YOU AGREE THAT THIS AGREEMENT IS ENFORCEABLE LIKE ANY WRITTEN CONTRACT SIGNED BY YOU.

body:
I have a question.
Does an individual have the right to break a "code of conduct" which they have agreed to?
I ask this because me and a friend of mine played a game of League earlier, and the enemy Leblanc presumably left because they died first blood, and my friend said that they had no right to leave.
But do they?
I am aware that in section V(5). CODE OF CONDUCT of the Terms of Use, there is this:
"M. Logging out or exiting the Game during live game-play. Riot Games’ automated Leaverbuster® system tracks this data overtime and issues a temporary ban when a user is determined to have left mid-game too many times. The length of the temporary ban will increase over time if a particular Account continues to leave live game play"
But there isn't anything particularly "enforcing" this other than your word, and there isn't anything that states that you, as a player, **don't** have the right to leave a game. Yes, there are consequences, but there's nothing (that I can find) saying that you don't have the right, and sure you are agreeing to the Terms of Use, but there's nothing stopping you from, at any moment, going against those Terms of Use.
So, do you or do you not have the right to leave a game?

replies.body: Its implied, we are allowed to leave, but we are not meant to leave

Quote from Section M : "Code of Conduct"
"Logging out or exiting the Game during live game-play. Riot Games’ automated Leaverbuster® system tracks this data overtime and issues a temporary ban when a user is determined to have left mid-game too many times. The length of the temporary ban will increase over time if a particular Account continues to leave live game play."

If we break it down in a more simplistic way , the paragraph itself is trying to tell us that whenever we log off or leave the game for any reason, Riot Games database keep track of it and remember of it so in case if you leave again , the system recorded the period and if seen leaving too many games the system will  " issue a temporary ban" . It is to encourage people to not leave the game , no point in the paragraph does it state that you can't leave the game ; it only state that if you leave a game while it is still active, it is recorded 

I assume the code of conduct were placed so that people don't leave before finishing a League games , it written as a warning not a rule therefore leave if you must (emergency or internet) or finish the game before leaving ! You do have the right to leave a game but do it at your own risk because you are basically ruining the "game play" of 4 other people that happens to be in the same queue as you
